result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W. Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W. Raymond

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:16 p.m.
State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence in person. Defendant appears via Zoom from Gogebic CO Jail, with Atty Heather Roehr in person.
VRCW. 

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to;
CT 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>AMEND TO: Misdemeanor Possession of Controlled Substance 961.41(3g)(b).
COURT grants above;
PLEA: 
CT 1 (Possession of a Controlled Substance)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: $25.00 fine plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample. 

Adjourned: 1:29 p.m.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

1:50 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears via Zoom video in custody; Attorney Heather Roehr appears in person.

Date and time set for JPTC.
Atty Roehr provides court with an update. Requests FPT/TPD date/time.
Defendant makes statement.
OTR: 1:50 p.m.
BOTR: 1:51 p.m.
COURT recites next FPT/TPD date/time.

NEXT DATE >>
FPT/TPD - 10/7/22 at 4:00 p.m.

ADJ: 1:51 p.m.

COURT will not issue warrant.  JPTC on 8/30/22 at 1:50p.m. to remain on the calendar.
